column4: it wouldbe nice to know why webmin isn't supported, as nobody seems to think zentyal is better
.. webmin is no longer supported in Debian and Ubuntu. It is not compatible with the way that Ubuntu packages handle configuration files..
hehe - basically its a bad idea, to give any web-application full (root-)access to config-files.
it's the same name as was working with cron.hourly, no dots: mysql_backup
grep daily /etc/crontab   do other daily-jobs work?
i'm not sure, how do i see if they work?
just create a new job, writing date every 2 mins into a /tmp/-file  to check
do you have anacron installed? if so, daily/weekly/monthly won't be executed by cron anymore. check anacrontab in that case
i didn't install it, as hourly was working already
hourly is always run by cron
anacrontab is there, but i didn't install it, so maybe i have to?
so check anacron, anacrontab, see logs.
seems to be no logs of it
